items.title: The first stars may not have been as uniformly massive as we thought

ai_summary: Research suggests the first stars may not have been uniformly massive.
Scientists are reevaluating previous assumptions about early star formation.
The findings could alter understanding of the early universe's evolution.
New models suggest a wider range of stellar masses existed.
The research is based on advanced simulations and observational data.
